The Rock class¶

The Rock class is used to inspect the properties of a single asteroid. The asteroid is specified by providing its number, name, or designation to the class.

>> from rocks import Rock
>> ceres = Rock(1)
>> ceres
Rock(number=1, name='Ceres')
>> vesta = Rock("1807 FA")
>> vesta
Rock(number=4, name='Vesta')

During instantiation, the asteroid properties are retrieved from SsODNet and assigned to the attributes following the structure of the ssoCard.

>> ceres.parameters.physical.taxonomy.class_
C
>> vesta.parameters.dynamical.proper_elements.proper_semi_major_aixs
2.3615126

To reduce wordiness, the parameters and physical/dynamical attributes can be skipped. Units and uncertainties can be appended to the property.

>> vesta.parameters.physical.diameter
468.3
>> vesta.diameter
468.3
>> vesta.diameter.unit
'km'

Note

The “class” property clashes with the python-protected class keyword. The property name is changed to “class_”.

Access of datacloud tables¶

SsODNet:datacloud contains tables of albedo, mass, taxonomic class estimations and more for a large number of asteroids. By default, they are not loaded when creating a Rock instance, as each table requires an additional remote query. Tables can be requested using the datacloud argument, using the catalogues given in the left column of the table below. They are assigned to the attributes given in the right column.

Datacloud Table

Attribute Name

aams

aams

astdys

astdys

astorb

astorb

binarymp_tab

binaries

diamalbedo

diamalbedo

families

families

masses

masses

mpcatobs

mpc

pairs

pairs

taxonomy

taxonomies

The properties in each table row entry are concatenated into lists, grouping properties of the same type together.

>> ceres = Rock(1, datacloud=['taxonomy', 'masses'])
>> ceres.taxonomies.class_
['G', 'C', 'C', 'C', 'C', 'G', 'C']
>> ceres.taxonomies.shortbib
['Tholen+1989', 'Bus&Binzel+2002', 'Lazzaro+2004', 'Lazzaro+2004',
 'DeMeo+2009', 'Fornasier+2014', 'Fornasier+2014']

If the properties are of type float, methods for weighted averaging and plotting are available.

>> ceres.masses.mass
[9.55e+20, 9.54e+20, 9.94e+20, 9.19e+20, ..., 9.39e+20]
>> ceres.masses.mass.weighted_average(errors=ceres.masses.err_mass)
(9.387431170184913e+20, 3.282260016750655e+17)

Note

The units and uncertainties are not appended to properties in the datacloud catalgoues. This may be implemented in a later version.

Creating many Rocks¶

The rocks.rocks() function quickly creates many Rock instances. It accepts a list of asteroid numbers, names, or designations and returns a list of Rock instances.

>>> from rocks import rocks
>>> themis_family = [24, 62, 90, 104, 171, 222, 223, 316, 379,
        383, 468, 492, 515, 526, 767, 846]
>>> themis_family = rocks(themis_family)
>>> themis_family
[Rock(number=316, name='Goberta'), Rock(number=492, name='Gismonda'),
Rock(number=767, name='Bondia'), Rock(number=90, name='Antiope'), ... ]

Accessing the properties can now be done with a loop or list comprehension.

>>> from collections import Counter
>>> themis_taxonomies = [t.taxonomy.class_ for t in themis_family]
>>> Counter(themis_taxonomies)
Counter({'C': 8, 'B': 2, 'Ch': 2, 'BU': 1, 'Xc': 1, 'Xk': 1, 'Cb': 1})

Any property not present in the ssoCard of an asteroid is set to NaN. This ensures that accessing attributes in a loop does not fail.

Note

ssoCards are cached for shorter execution times. The cache directory is $HOME/.cache/rocks/.

In the Tutorials we show how to utilise rocks() to investigate the taxonomic distribution of asteroids in large catalogues.

API of Rock and rocks¶

class core.Rock(identifier, ssoCard=None, datacloud=[], skip_id_check=False)[source]¶

For space rocks.

Rock.__init__(identifier, ssoCard=None, datacloud=[], skip_id_check=False)[source]¶

Identify a minor body and retrieve its properties from SsODNet.

Parameters

  • identifier (str, int, float) – Identifying asteroid name, designation, or number

  • ssoCard (dict) – Optional previously acquired ssoCard.

  • datacloud (list of str) – List of additional catalogues to retrieve from datacloud. Default is no additional catalogues.

Returns

An asteroid class instance, with its properties as attributes.

Return type

rocks.core.Rock

Notes

If the asteroid could not be identified, the name and number are None and no further attributes are set.

Example

>>> from rocks.core import Rock
>>> ceres = Rock('ceres')
>>> ceres.taxonomy.class_
'C'
>>> ceres.taxonomy.shortbib
'DeMeo+2009'
>>> ceres.diameter
848.4
>>> ceres.diameter.unit
'km'
core.rocks()¶

For space rocks. Interface for SsODNet.

core.listSameTypeParameter.weighted_average(self, errors=False)¶

Compute weighted average of float-type parameters.

Parameters

errors (list of floats, np.ndarraya of floats) – Optional list of associated uncertainties. Default is unit unceratinty.

Returns

  • (float, float)

  • Weighted average and its uncertainty.
